meanings.definition: An obstacle or difficulty to be overcome
meanings.sent1: The math test was a hurdle for the students.
meanings.sent2: The team faced a hurdle when their bus broke down.
meanings.sent3: Trying to eat soup with a fork was a funny hurdle.
meanings.sent4: Overcoming his fear of heights was a huge hurdle for him.
meanings.sent5: The hurdle of learning to ride a bike seemed insurmountable at first.

meanings.definition: A frame or fence for jumping over in a race
meanings.sent1: The athletes practiced jumping over the hurdles on the track.
meanings.sent2: The hurdle on the racetrack was set at a challenging height.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the hurdle in the garden was a fun playground.
meanings.sent4: The hurdle loomed ahead like a tall gate to success.
meanings.sent5: The hurdle in the race seemed to grow taller with each step.

meanings.definition: To jump over an obstacle or barrier
meanings.sent1: She had to hurdle the fallen tree to continue on the trail.
meanings.sent2: The athlete skillfully hurdled the barrier and won the race.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to hurdle the bathtub but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: He had to hurdle many challenges to reach his goal.
meanings.sent5: The superhero could hurdle buildings in a single bound.
